title: Selected Study Modules
description: Students undertake a Selected Study Module (SSM), working on it throughout the academic year. The aim of SSM is to provide students with an opportunity to participate in a research project, critique scientific literature, conduct a topical analysis or systematic review, and acquire some of the skill sets needed for undertaking scientific research. Allowing free choice of project facilitates students to critically explore topics that they find interesting.Students who have successfully completed the Master of Science Programme in Research Medicine or GPS students who have successfully completed the interim report of the GPSU3100 GPS Project are exempted from the course.
outcome: After the SSM, the student should be able to: 1. realize the importance of life-long, self-directed learning, and 2. appreciate the necessity of having skills to acquire new knowledge in order to meet the challenge of society's ever changing demands.
syllabus: Free choice of project areas will enable students to explore critically and pursue subjects and topics that excite them.
required_readings: All textbooks as listed on the Faculty website.
recommended_readings: All recommended references as listed on the Faculty website.
